Posts.EditableText: After closing the script editor with OK after a print text entry, Print"" is inserted on the end.
Posts.HTML: After closing the script editor with OK after a print text entry, Print"" is inserted on the end.

Posts.EditableText: I think you can just delete it. Open the script editor again and click the little cross. If that doesn't work, could you send me a screenshot so I know what you mean?
Posts.HTML: I think you can just delete it. Open the script editor again and click the little cross. If that doesn't work, could you send me a screenshot so I know what you mean?

Posts.EditableText: Thanks for the reply. This doesn't happen every time, and I'm not too sure what I might have been doing at the time. The script editor goes a bit awry when using the align text feature but Alex straightened me out on that one by using the |jc etc, commands. I've been trying different script entries to try and tie it down to a particular event, but, as yet no definite cause. Will post back when I've got something concrete to look at.
Posts.HTML:
Thanks for the reply.
This doesn't happen every time, and I'm not too sure what I might have been doing at the time. The script editor goes a bit awry when using the align text feature but Alex straightened me out on that one by using the |jc etc, commands. I've been trying different script entries to try and tie it down to a particular event, but, as yet no definite cause. Will post back when I've got something concrete to look at.

Posts.EditableText: I've just figured out why this happens. If you do a Print text command, and that is the last script entry and click OK, all is fine. If you follow the Print text command by clicking Add More and then quitting with OK you get a blank print statement (Print"") because Print was selected in the menu. I think this is all down to my mis-understanding of the editing procedure and I apologise for the original posting.
Posts.HTML: I've just figured out why this happens. If you do a Print text command, and that is the last script entry and click OK, all is fine. If you follow the Print text command by clicking Add More and then quitting with OK you get a blank print statement (Print"") because Print was selected in the menu. I think this is all down to my mis-understanding of the editing procedure and I apologise for the original posting.
